definition: thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

pinyin: Shang4 hai3 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3 Zong1 he2 Gu3 jia4 Zhi3
containing_words.word: 上海证券交易所综合股价指

sentences.chinese: 奥林巴斯股价周二狂泻了29%。

sentences.english: Since then, HP's stock has jumped 22% to $28.
sentences.chinese: 此后，惠普的股价已升至28美元，上涨了22%。

sentences.english: At the same time, short-term traders bought to reverse bets that stock prices would fall.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，短线交易员逆市买入，押注股价回升。

sentences.english: That puts the stock on a still-heady multiple of 23 times earnings.
sentences.chinese: 以这一股价折算的雅虎预期市盈率仍然高达23倍。

sentences.english: 'I don't see any room for its share price to rise soon, ' says Mr. Yao.
sentences.chinese: 姚宏光说，他认为该股股价近期难有上升空间。

sentences.english: In that case, the price spike would be something like a dead-cat bounce.
sentences.chinese: 在那种情况下，股价峰值可能会像死猫诈尸一样反弹。

sentences.english: Market-watchers had forecast the Link's share price would rise up to 10 per cent on its debut.
sentences.chinese: 市场人士原预期领汇股价会在上市首日升百分之十。

sentences.english: For example the stock price of the company Higashi Nihon House, has been rising unnaturally for the past month.
sentences.chinese: 例如，东日本楼公司的股价，在上个月非自然抬升。

sentences.english: Bumi's share price is down by two-fifths from a year ago.
sentences.chinese: 股价也比一年前跌了五分之二。

sentences.english: Right now, stock prices have all the fascination of a bloody car wreck.
sentences.chinese: 现在，股价拥有了这个破车的所有魅力。

sentences.english: TSMC share prices skyrocketed to reach the ceiling price of 60 NT in mid-session.
sentences.chinese: 盘中台积电股价急拉大涨，一度冲高到60元涨停。

sentences.english: Shares in rival Isuzu Motors also fell.
sentences.chinese: 五十铃汽车股价也下跌。

sentences.english: The loan is on his account on Thursday. But the price is much higher than that on the previous day.
sentences.chinese: 那笔贷款周四到账了，当天的股价又高出一大截。

sentences.english: I guess the share price will goup.
You count for me how many limits it will have to seventeen.
sentences.chinese: 你算算，需要多少个跌停板才能使股价掉到十七元。

sentences.english: It is the risk that share price fluctuates considerably.
sentences.chinese: 三是股价大幅波动的风险。

definition: to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
